Class JobVisuals

  • java.lang.Object
    • JobVisuals

  • public class JobVisuals
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles all of the data regarding GUI job elements. Objects of this class handles animations of itself and must be updated to animate.
    Author:
    Min-Jae Yi

    • Constructor Detail

      • JobVisuals

        public JobVisuals(int pid,
          int cpuTimeRequired,
          int spdMultiplier)
        Constructor requires data that is relevant to the Job class. This is to set up the animation that relates this to its respective job.
        Parameters:
        pid - Job's process ID
        cpuTimeRequired - Time the job requires to finish
        spdMultiplier - The speed of the animation

    • Method Detail

      • updateJobVisual

        public boolean updateJobVisual()
        Handles the positioning of the GUI job element. It only moves the GUI job element closer to its destination per call, so this method must be repeatedly called to arrive to its proper position.
        Returns:
        If the GUI job element is at its final position

      • setSpeedMultiplier

        public void setSpeedMultiplier(int multiplier)
        Sets the animation speed multiplier.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - Integer multiplier

      • setImage

        public void setImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage jobImage)
        Sets the image of the GUI job element for the animatino.
        Parameters:
        jobImage - Image that the GUI job element should be

      • setFinished

        public void setFinished()
        Sets the path of animation to the position where the job goes when it is finished being processed by the CPU.

      • setNewPosition

        public void setNewPosition(int x,
                  int y)
        Sets the new position of the GUI job element to where it needs to animate to. The GUI job element does not move there immediately.
        Parameters:
        x - X position of the GUI job element
        y - Y position of the GUI job element

      • moveToCPU

        public void moveToCPU()
        Sets the animation path of the GUI job element to the position of the GUI CPU.

      • moveToQueue

        public void moveToQueue()
        Sets the animation path of the GUI job element to the position of the GUI queue of appropriate level.

      • decTime

        public void decTime()
        Decrements the time of the GUI job element.

      • decQueueDepth

        public void decQueueDepth()
        Decrements the depth of the GUI job element within a queue. This causes the element to shift up in the animation.

      • getPID

        public int getPID()
        Returns the process ID of this GUI job element.
        Returns:
        PID

      • getTimeLeft

        public int getTimeLeft()
        Gets the remaining time left of the GUI job element.
        Returns:
        Remaining time integer

      • getQueueLevel

        public int getQueueLevel()
        Returns the current queue that the GUI job element sits in.
        Returns:
        The queue level of the GUI job element

      • getNewPostion

        public java.awt.Dimension getNewPostion()
        Returns where the new position of the GUI job element is.
        Returns:
        New position of the GUI job element

      • getPosition

        public java.awt.Dimension getPosition()
        Returns the current position of the GUI job element.
        Returns:
        Position of the GUI job element

      • setPosition

        private void setPosition(int x,
               int y)
        Sets the current position of the GUI job element to the given x and y.
        Parameters:
        x - X position
        y - Y position

      • moveToNewPos

        private void moveToNewPos()
        Moves the GUI job element some determined amount of distance towards the new position. Must be called multiple times to reach new position.

      • setStatus

        private void setStatus()
        Sets the status of the GUI job element to print out.

      • pathSet

        private void pathSet()
        Sets the positions of the GUI job element. These coordinates are hardcoded into the system and must change when the GUI faces new changes.

      • drawText

        protected void drawText(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Handles drawing the text for the GUI job element. The text outputs data regarding the GUI job element.
        Parameters:
        g - Buffer that all the drawing happens on

      • drawImage

        protected void drawImage(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the given image of the GUI job element.
        Parameters:
        g - Buffer that all the drawing happens on
